alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Logan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:10AM CDT until May 19 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 AM CDT FOR KAY...NORTHEASTERN KINGFISHER...NOBLE...NORTHEASTERN ALFALFA... GRANT...NORTHWESTERN LOGAN...NORTHWESTERN PAYNE AND GARFIELD COUNTIES... At 310 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Wakita to near Deer Creek to 5 miles west of Red Rock to near Lake Carl Blackwell, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Enid, Stillwater, Ponca City, Blackwell, Perry, Tonkawa, Medford, Newkirk, Pond Creek, Garber, Morrison, Glencoe, Covington, Billings, Lamont, Kaw City, Wakita, Red Rock, Marshall and Kremlin. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
